p.b:
All events are cancelled and school is now closed
thr
p.strong: ought the remainder of this school year.

hr.p:
The Eagle Café at North Central Schools will be providing grab and go meals for all students in the NC District on Mondays and Thursdays. On Monday each student will receive 3 breakfast and lunch meals. On Thursday each student will receive 2 breakfast and lunch meals.
We will have a drive-thru line for all students in Pioneer to pick up meals. The line will be in north parking lot by the auditeria, off Baubice Street from 11:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m. The pick-up person must have the student first and last name with student ID number. Please order in advance.
Students on a regular bus stop can get meals delivered to a regular bus stop. All orders for delivery need to be requested by 7:00 a.m. of the delivery day, as we will start deliveries around 10:00 a.m. Deliveries must be ordered in advance.
Please email requests to rtaylor@northcentralschool.org or leave a message at 419/737-2392 extension 5216. Be sure to include pick up or delivery, student first and last name, grade, student ID, and bus route address for delivery. Remember, only regular bus stops will be delivered to. Pre-order to guarantee meals.
We are here to serve in this time of need. We are NC strong and NC proud!

font.span:
Welcome to Our Community and School!
The North Central Local School District is located in northern Williams County in Pioneer, Ohio. Pioneer is a small, close-knit community with an approximate population of 1500 people. A new building for the high school was recently constructed, opening in the 2016-17 school year, which finalized the preschool through grade12 campus facility update. The school district is a small rural district with an enrollment of approximately 600 students. We have recently updated our technology and infrastructure to be equipped to handle the age of technology. One to one computing is used for students in grades 1-12 so each student has access to a laptop/tablet daily. The latest technology is also being used in the classrooms by our entire staff.
The school is a vital part of the village and a source of pride for the entire community. The North Central Local School District is proud to offer high quality academics, programs, facilities, and staff. We are committed to the pursuit of excellence and continuous improvement. In large part, this is the result of the involvement of our parents and community members, the commitment of our staff members and the dedication of our student body.

span.br:
The mission of the North Central School District is to provide current instructional tools and methods which ensure success throughout the student's educational career. Employees will strive to listen and understand student and family needs. Employees will provide a positive learning environment where they can guide students to make informed choices. It is the ultimate goal that students graduate from North Central High School with a foundation of knowledge for success and a desire for life-long learning.
Join the team at North Central Local Schools to support the students and community:

font.span: Substitute Teachers and Paraprofessionals for our districts are recruited by the Northwest Ohio Educational Service Center. Please visit their website to begin the hiring process http://www.nwoesc.org/substitutes or contact the NwOESC directly at (567) 444-4806.

span.em:
North Central Local Schools Transportation Department has a new guideline to follow for drop off and pick up of bus riders for 2019- 2020. All parents of bus riders need to fill out a Transportation/ Alternate Request form that was mailed home last week. If you have not received one, see link to the left (Transportation Forms) under Parent Resources.
419/ 737- 2392 X 5206
or email: emoreland@northcentralschool.org
Each student will now only be allowed to have one bus pick-up and drop-off location. Please review the letter and form that you receive in the mail. Feel free to contact Mr. Moreland with any questions or concerns that you may have.

p.span:
State of Ohio Update!
The State of Ohio, the Governor, the Ohio Department of Education, and other state-level defendants to a class action lawsuit have reached a proposed settlement and have requested our district's assistance in informing students and parents of the proposed settlement. To be clear, our district is not a defendant in this lawsuit and is not accused of any wrongdoing in this lawsuit. We are sharing this information as a courtesy to the Ohio Department of Education and our community.
Click on this link for details.
